p: SHEO was obtained by Dikbas et al. [ 34] from wild-growing Turkish plants, having as major components carvacrol (54.7%), γ-terpinene (20.9%), p-cymene (12.3%), α-terpinene (2.0%), and thymol (2.0%). The exposure to SHEO vapors reduced the decay of strawberry and grape fruit in post-harvest stage, especially at low temperatures (5 and 10 °C), in a dose-dependent manner. Similar results were obtained on grapes at post-harvest stage [ 35], as well as on fruits and vegetables post-harvest fungi. The effect of SHEO extracted from Iranian plants was observed on Penicillium digitatum and Rhizopus stolonifer) [ 36], R. stolonifer, P. digitatum, Aspergillus niger and Botrytis cinerea [ 37], Aspergillus species [ 38] and Rhizopus stolonifera [ 39]. The obtained results offer the possibility to develop natural antifungals for disease control in post-harvest stage.
